#COVID19 Statistics: 3 May 2021 4th consecutive day daily pos. rate is above 5% In the past 7 days, we have averaged a daily pos. rate of 5.54% - 897 New Cases - 780 New Recoveries - 35 New Deaths - 21 951 Active Cases - Daily Pos. Rate: 5.35% https://t.co/ymwDInhWpI
@lu_lulama Yep, theyre on the way. They just got posted 20 mins ago

@Damin_za @ColindaKvam1 I understand that but things are within reason especially when lives are on the line. My reasoning is that the sooner you can overcome COVID-19 (ie avoid gatherings like above) the soon it can be business as usual.

@DevonBaard121 Blaming the youth and them choosing to vaccinate or not has almost a zero correlation. They arent mutually exclusive. Work with people in what way? Theyre adults, they understand their actions. Were nearing a 3rd wave so this is the first time. Dont get your reasoning

@DevonBaard121 People are at fault. Fact. Holding peoples actions accountable is needed. You cannot use the argument that some might be immune and it will be fine. Thats just illogical. The least at risk put the most vulnerable at risk. Remember were in a pandemic. Jolling can wait.
@DameezyYouCrazy Will include weekly averages but dm for guest list tho https://t.co/Qh2RkNTirH

@Damin_za @ColindaKvam1 What business is that exactly? Protocols are literally not for the rich. The amount of breadwinners that have died during peaks is massive. Were still in a pandemic. Crowding in a area and not following basic protocol just for good time is highly selfish.
@DameezyYouCrazy I cannot comment about my Tiger Tiger experiences however I would highly recommend. Origin and Cuba (stadium) comes in a close 2nd
@Abhi_budhram People were literally on top of each other at Keys
@Damin_za @ColindaKvam1 You can still go areas like this and still maintain the relevant protocol. I really dont see your point

@Damin_za @ColindaKvam1 If you were there you would see that were in fact not. People walking about because all tables were fully packed with no distance between them. Theres literally no regard for any protocol.

Stopped off on the Florida Road, Durban for a quick spot of ice cream only to see this. Behaviour and gatherings like will be the main reason for the start of the 3rd wave. Overcrowded areas and no masks in sight. https://t.co/IscMMeVoxq
@TerranceBezuid1 Thank you. It is a worry. Its indicative of a change. Weve this trend before and normally leads to 3rd wave. It is something to worry about.
@dbbovey The mass rollout starts in 2 weeks. We should see vaccine numbers rocket after May 17th

SA #COVID19 Vaccinations Stats: 02 May 2021 1st batch of #Pfizer vaccines arrived in SA today. Will receive 325k doses weekly till the end of May Thereafter 636k weekly till end of June totalling 4.5M doses Total Administered: 318 670 Administered Today: 0 Remaining: 506 590 https://t.co/gmHXk2BadH

#COVID19 Statistics: 2 May 2021 Concerning day for positivity rate- surpasses 7% In the past 7 days, we have averaged a daily pos. rate of 5.49% - 1 222 New Cases - 1 046 New Recoveries - 11 New Deaths - 21 869 Active Cases - Daily Pos. Rate: 7.55% https://t.co/W6GQNNIa3N
@katinkies Something is better than nothing. We've got to start somewhere. Around 320k a week is impressive. For now we can stop the spread by following the relevant protocols.
Once again, @miamalan with an excellent thread regarding the vaccine! https://t.co/UnLjLtHE64
